availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David O. Harris (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer, grocer, and politician)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer, grocer, and politician. Kentucky native. Filed a marriage bond to Mary Hannah McKinney in Woodford County, Kentucky, on May 8, 1849. Father of Fannie Harris, Ellen Harris, and Mary Harris. Farmer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Grocer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Member of the Versailles Board of Trustees in Woodford County in 1861. Farmer in Woodford County in 1863.
